intro: Hexameria, commonly known as the desert honeysuckle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Loganiaceae. It consists of several species native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. The plants are shrubs or small trees characterized by their opposite, simple leaves and showy, tubular flowers. Hexameria species typically have yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. They are adapted to arid environments, showcasing features such as succulent stems and reduced leaves to conserve water.
